intro: Schmidelia natalensis, commonly known as Natal schmidelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky habitats and open woodlands. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Schmidelia natalensis is often found in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
